org.mobilesynergies.android.epic.service
Class EpicService

java.lang.Object
  Service
      org.mobilesynergies.android.epic.service.EpicService

public class EpicService
extends Service

The service running as a background process on Android. It offers two interfaces:

  • An interface for 3rd party applications to bind to (see EpicServiceApplicationInterface).
  • An interface for activities that configure the service or show the status of the service (see EpicServiceAdministrationInterface).
The EpicService class is responsible to establish a connection to the epic network when possible. It handles changes in network (i.e., internet) availability and manages the EPIC client.

getState

onBind

public IBinder onBind(Intent intent)
Overriding the android.os.Service function onBind. Activities can either bind to the application interface by launching a intent with action org.mobilesynergies.EPIC_SERVICE, or to the administration interface by launching an intent with the action set to the class name of the administration interface.

Returns:
Returns the desired interface to the calling activity or null if no appropriate action was specified.

onCreate

public void onCreate()
Called when the service is created

onDestroy

public void onDestroy()

onStart

public void onStart(Intent intent,
                    int startId)
Called when the service is started. The service is either started by an application (respectively the user), or by the NetworkConnectivityStatusReceiver.

registerPresenceCallback

registerServiceStatusChangeCallback

public void registerServiceStatusChangeCallback(IServiceStatusChangeCallback callback)
The application can register a callback to be informed about changes of service state.

Parameters:
callback - The callback that will be notified about changes

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String action,
                        java.lang.String sessionId,
                        Bundle data)
Send one (of potentially many) reply message to a caller for a performed epic action. The caller is identified by the sessionid only. If the session id is invalid the message will be ignored. An activity that wants to send a message needs to specify the appropriate permission in its AndroidManifest file.

Parameters:
action - The action that was or is being performed
sessionId - The session id received from the caller
data - The data that is the result of the action

stop

public void stop()
Call this function to stop the service. Available only to the administration interface
